Kuliner Khas Indonesia Goyang Lidah Orang Mesir
04 Nov 2019, 21:36 by Roky Pratama



Kuliner Khas Indonesia Goyang Lidah Orang Mesir

Kuliner Khas Indonesia Goyang Lidah Orang Mesir


KBRN, Mesir : Ternyata lidah orang Mesir banyak yang bisa menyesuaikan dengan masakan khas Indonesia. Dari 60 orang asing yang diundang dalam Pekan Kuliner Indonesia pada 3 November 2019, bertempat di Restoran Kamala Hotel Conrad Cairo, hampir semuanya mengaku tergoda untuk terus mencicipi berbagai hidangan kuliner Indonesia yang disajikan, seperti rendang, ayam betutu, sate ayam, laksa dan soto.Dua orang chef berkewarganegaan Indonesia yaitu Agus Hermawan dan Hendri Yuswa yang sehari-harinya merupakan chef di salah satu restoran Indonesia di Amsterdam, Belanda, sengaja dihadirkan untuk menyajikan berbagai masakan khas Indonesia dalam kegiatan yang bertemakan “The Flavor of Indonesia", kerjasama antara KBRI Kairo dengan Restoran Kamala. Seorang Jurnalis Mesir, Rabab Fathy memuji makanan khas Indonesia. “Rasa makanannya sangat enak. Penyajian sangat menarik. Chef berhasil menyuguhkan makan khas Indonesia yang dapat diterima oleh lidah masyarakat Mesir,” ujarnya.Bukan hanya Rabab yang asli orang Mesir, tapi Wakil Dubes Mexico di Kairo, Jose Barojas mengaku acara malam itu membuatnya seakan kembali berada di Indonesia.“Kami pernah tinggal di Indonesia selama 6 tahun. Masakan Indonesia malam ini, luar biasa, saya suka semuanya,” ungkap Jose.Duta Besar (Dubes) Republik Indonesia untuk Mesir, Helmy Fauzy mengatakan selain gencar mempromosikan destinasi wisata Indonesia, mengenalkan hidangan khas Indonesia kepada masyarakat asing di Kairo dianggap juga tidak kalah penting.“Masakan Indonesia memiliki rasa yang khas karena selain kaya akan bumbu rempah-rempah juga sebagian dipengaruhi oleh cita rasa dari negara-negara Arab, India dan China, semuanya bercampur secara sempurna menjadi cita rasa Indonesia,” ujar pria kelahiran Balikpapan itu. Para tamu yang hadir dari kalangan diplomatik, pejabat pemerintah dan pengusaha dari Mesir serta kalangan media sebagian besar menyatakan bahwa mereka baru pertama kali mencicipi masakan Indonesia. Rasa dari racikan bumbu dan resep asli Indonesia membuat selera mereka tergoda untuk terus mencicipi hidangan yang disediakan. Restoran Kamala yang menjadi tempat penyelenggaraan Pekan Kuliner Indonesia juga menghadirkan atmosfir Indonesia melalui dekorasi batik, wayang, payung tradisional serta hiasan penjor ala Indonesia. Selain itu, alunan musik khas Indonesia juga menambah kentalnya nuansa Indonesia. Sebagai tambahan, selain menyediakan paket makan malam ala Indonesia, rangkaian kegiatan Pekan Kuliner Indonesia juga diisi dengan kegiatan belajar memasak dan demo masak dari chef Indonesia.

Typical Indonesian Cuisine Shakes the Tongue of the Egyptians
Nov 04 2019, 21:36 by Roky Pratama



Typical Indonesian Cuisine Shakes the Tongue of the Egyptians



Typical Indonesian Cuisine Shakes the Tongue of the Egyptians



Typical Indonesian Cuisine Shakes the Tongue of the Egyptians



Typical Indonesian Cuisine Shakes the Tongue of the Egyptians


KBRN, Egypt: It turns out that many Egyptian tongues can adapt to Indonesian specialties. Of the 60 foreigners invited to the Indonesian Culinary Week on November 3, 2019, at the Kamala Hotel Conrad Cairo Hotel, almost all of them claimed to be tempted to continue to taste various Indonesian culinary dishes that were served, such as rendang, chicken satay, chicken satay, laksa and soto. Two Indonesian chefs, Agus Hermawan and Hendri Yuswa, who are chefs at one of the Indonesian restaurants in Amsterdam, the Netherlands, were intentionally presented to present a variety of Indonesian specialties in activities with the theme "The Flavor of Indonesia", a collaboration between the Indonesian Embassy in Cairo with the Kamala Restaurant. An Egyptian journalist, Rabab Fathy praised Indonesian specialties. "The taste of the food was very good. The presentation was very interesting. The chef managed to present Indonesian special food that could be accepted by the tongue of the Egyptian people," he said. but the Deputy Ambassador of Mexico in Cairo, Jose Barojas claimed the night's event was making it was as if he were back in Indonesia. "We have lived in Indonesia for 6 years. Indonesian cuisine tonight, is amazing, I like it all, "said Jose. Ambassador of the Republic of Indonesia to Egypt, Helmy Fauzy said that in addition to aggressively promoting Indonesian tourist destinations, introducing typical Indonesian dishes to foreign people in Cairo was also considered to be no less important "Indonesian cuisine has a distinctive taste because in addition to being rich in spices, it is also partly influenced by the tastes of the Arab countries, India and China, all of which mixes perfectly into Indonesian flavors," said the man born in Balikpapan. Guests present from diplomatic circles, government officials and businessmen from Egypt and the media mostly said that this was their first time tasting Indonesian cuisine. The flavors of the original Indonesian spices and recipes make it tempting to continue to taste the dishes provided. Kamala Restaurant which is the venue for the Indonesian Culinary Week also presents the Indonesian atmosphere through batik decorations, puppets, traditional umbrellas and Indonesian-style penjor decorations. In addition, the strains of typical Indonesian music also add to the thick feel of Indonesia. In addition, in addition to providing Indonesian-style dinner packages, a series of Indonesian Culinary Week activities are also filled with cooking learning activities and cooking demonstrations from Indonesian chefs.
